intro: Ortholoma lehmannii, commonly known as Lehmann's ortholoma, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Chile. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small white or greenish flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal habitats, thriving in well-drained soils. It is often found in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to harsh climatic conditions. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species in its native range.
